text: Creevy (Ir. An Chraobhaigh 'the place of branches or trees') is a townland in the County Down parish of Aghaderg, in the barony of Iveagh, near Loughbrickland, Banbridge, N. Ireland. Creevy has an area of 470.82 acres. ==Sources== *Placenamesni.org Category:Villages in County Down Category:Civil parish of Aghaderg
title: Creevy
